page.title: 02Wick Schools
page.content: One of Wick's four schools might be closed in 1986 because we have too many schools for such a small town.Either the Hillhead School or Pulteney town Academy might be closed.Pulteney town Academy is being considered for closure because of the bad condition of the building.If the Hillhead school is going to be closed down it will be because it doesn't have enough pupils.The North school shall not be closed as it has a large number of pupils and the South school is a brand new school.Which ever school they decide to close the pupils shall be sent to the North school.The Wick parents are not pleased about this and each school has had a separate meeting so the parents of the children concerned can express their arguments to the Education Committee.
